io.leonis.algieba.calculus

Interface ParametricLineIntegral

  • All Superinterfaces:
    LineIntegral
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LocalLinearLineIntegral
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GaussianPotentialField, HydrodynamicPotentialField, UniformFlowPotentialField

    public interface ParametricLineIntegral
extends LineIntegral
    /** The Interface ParametricLineIntegral. This interface represents the functionality of an object which represents a continuous function for which a line integral, with a linear path, can be calculated by single variable parametrization.

      Computes the indefinite integral along the line between the supplied lower and upper bounds parametrized by a single variable.

      • getLineIntegral

        default double getLineIntegral(org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray lowerBound,
                               org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray upperBound,
                               double parameterLowerBound,
                               double parameterUpperBound)
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - The lower bound of the line integral.
        upperBound - The upper bound of the line integral.
        parameterLowerBound - The lower bound of the parametrized integral.
        parameterUpperBound - The upper bound of the parametrized integral.
        Returns:
        The value of the integral along the line between the supplied lower and upper bounds by parametrization through a single variable.

      • computeLineIntegral

        java.util.function.UnaryOperator<java.lang.Double> computeLineIntegral(org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray lowerBound,

        Computes the indefinite integral along the line between the supplied lower and upper bounds parametrized by a single variable.
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - The lower bound of the integral.
        upperBound - The upper bound of the integral.
        Returns:
        A UnaryOperator representing the result of an indefinite integral for which the value can be computed.
